      • getJSON

        public java.lang.String getJSON()
        This method returns the current JSON
        Returns:
        JSON string

      • visualize

        public void visualize()
        This method calls the updateGraph() or updateSL() methods depending upon the type of ADT being created. These methods send the JSON to post() which ultimately executes the http request from the server

      • updateGraph

        public void updateGraph()
        Update visualization metadata of graph using adjacency matrix. This may be called many times. This is usually an expensive operation and involves connecting to the network. Calling this method is optional provided you call complete()

      • updateSL

        public void updateSL()
        Update visualization metadata of singly linked list. This may be called many times. This is usually an expensive operation and involves connecting to the network. Calling this method is optional provided you call complete()

      • updateDL

        public void updateDL()
        Update visualization metadata of doubly linked list. This may be called many times. This is usually an expensive operation and involves connecting to the network. Calling this method is optional provided you call complete()

      • updateGraphL

        public void updateGraphL()
        Update visualization metadata of Graph with Adjacency List. This may be called many times. This is usually an expensive operation and involves connecting to the network. Calling this method is optional provided you call complete()

      • complete

        public void complete()
        Close down DataFormatters. This only calls update() but it could conceivably do more.
        Parameters:
        i -
